page.title: 20Historic Building- Church
page.content: {The Parish Church was opened in {1773 after thirteen years work. In 1662 Arthur Hill constructed "a spacious church on rising ground in the form of a cross, dedicated to{St. {Malachias."}The remnants of this early church are clearly to be found in today's structure, which was the work of the greatest Hill of all, Wills. It stands virtually unchanged today flanked by the graveyard and Fort, looking down three hundred metres of tree-lined lawn to the centre of the village. In the{Tower}there is a peal of eight bells installed in 1772, with an electric carillon to ring a hymn tune every day at every fourth hour. { The Hill family vault}lies under the north transept.{The high box pews are made of local oak.
